member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ICentroid
member.summary: This interface describes information about a centroid peak.

remarks.para: An instance of this class will be created by .

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ICentroid.IsExceptional
member.summary: Get access to the flag whether this peak is an artificial exception. null is returned if the value couldn't be determined.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ICentroid.IsReferenced
member.summary: Get access to the flag whether this peak is a referenced (lock mass) peak. null is returned if the value couldn't be determined.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ICentroid.IsMerged
member.summary: Get access to the flag whether this peak is a merged peak. null is returned if the value couldn't be determined.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ICentroid.IsFragmented
member.summary: Get access to the flag whether this peak is a fragmented peak. null is returned if the value couldn't be determined.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ICentroid.Charge
member.summary: Get access to the charge state. null is returned if this value couldn't be determined.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ICentroid.Profile
member.summary: Get access to the profile information. The return value will be an empty array if no profile information is related to this centroid.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ICentroid.Resolution
member.summary: Get access to the resolution information. The return value will be null if the resolution is not available for the peak, otherwise it contains the resolution.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ICentroid.ChargeEnvelopeIndex
member.summary:
Get access to the charge envelope index. The value is optional and depends on the availability of information in the instrument and proper identification.
If available, all centroids with the same charge envelope index belong to the same molecule having a specific isotope configuration. Properties of the charge envelope can be examined by [ChargeEnvelopeIndex].
A value of null doesn't necessarily mean that other centroids do not belong to the same molecule than this centroid.
member.remarks: This is an enhancement for better centroid characterization done in 2016.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ICentroid.IsMonoisotopic
member.summary: Get access to the flag whether this peak is a monoisotopic peak. null is returned if the value couldn't be determined.
member.remarks: This is an enhancement for better centroid characterization done in 2016.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ICentroid.IsClusterTop
member.summary: Get access whether this centroid is identified as having the top-peak mass within the charge envelope.
member.remarks:
The top peak is that peak in a charge envelope that fulfils two requirements in this order: 1) never being considered to be part of another charge envelope, and 2) having the highest abundance.
This is an enhancement for better centroid characterization done in 2016.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.IChargeEnvelope
member.summary: This interface covers charge envelopes. All isotopes just having a different charge belong to the same charge envelope.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.IChargeEnvelope.MonoisotopicMass
member.summary: This is the monoisotopic mass that a particular peak belongs to. The value is a calculated one, it is very likely that this cannot be seen at all in the spectrum. But it is the reference point of all members of one charge envelope.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.IChargeEnvelope.CrossCorrelation
member.summary:
This cross-correlation factor is the maximum of all cross-correlation values over all averagines. An averagine is a statistical model of the isotope distribution of the same molecule (see remarks of ) at a given charge. The observed peaks within the spectrum are fitted to this, the overlap is calculated by a cross-correlation that only takes the intensities into account.
The averagine model is strongly linked to peptide analysis. As an example, averagine mass distribution for pesticides are totally different.
Cross-correlation factors vary in the range 0 to 1. 0 will be set if is also 0. In this case, the fit was unsuccessful.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.IChargeEnvelope.TopPeakCentroidId
member.summary: This is the index to the top peak centroid in the centroid list (). One can use this to get access to the mass of the so called top peak.
member.remarks: The top peak is that peak in a charge envelope that fulfils two requirements in this order: 1) never being considered to be part of another charge envelope, and 2) having the highest abundance.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.IInformationSourceAccess
member.summary: This interface defines the functionality to access a particular information source which is usually TuneData, Trailer or StatusLog (wording known to Xcalibur users).

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.IInformationSourceAccess.ItemNames
member.summary: Access to the items by use of their name. The returned value is sorted according to its original order and contains also comment entries.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.IInformationSourceAccess.TryGetRawValue(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Try to retrieve the value of an item.
member.param: The name for that the content shall be returned
member.returns: Returns true if the item has been found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.IInformationSourceAccess.TryGetValue(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Try to retrieve the textual representation of an item.
member.param: The name for that the content shall be returned
textual representation of the value of the item
member.returns: Returns true if the item has been found, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.IInformationSourceAccess.Available
member.summary: Return whether this particular information source has been made available by the instrument.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.IInformationSourceAccess.Valid
member.summary: Return whether this particular information source block matches the expected format.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.IMassIntensity
member.summary: This interface is used to store the basic information about peaks.

remarks.para: Derived classes are and . An instance of this class will be created by .

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.IMassIntensity.Mz
member.summary: m/z value of the information.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.IMassIntensity.Intensity
member.summary: Intensity at the given m/z value.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ISpectrum
member.summary: This class describes a spectrum without information coming alongh with it.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ISpectrum.DetectorName
member.summary:
Get access to the name of the detector that acquired this scan.
Example: The instrument name may be "Thermo Orbitrap Velos Pro", the detector class may be "Hybrid LinearIonTrap Orbitrap" and the scan detector name may be "LinearIonTrap".

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ISpectrum.NoiseCount
member.summary: Get access to the number of elements returned by . The value will be null if the detector doesn't support noise information at all. 0 will be returned if no peaks below noise level were cut off, 1 will be returned for a constant level of the returned intensity.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ISpectrum.NoiseBand
member.summary: Get access to the noise information. The noise nodes form a polygon that covers the noise area. An empty enumeration is returned if noise information is not present. This value will not be null.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ISpectrum.CentroidCount
member.summary: Get access to the number of centroids in this scan. The value is null if the detector is not capable to provide centroids. The value may also be null if a computation cannot be performed.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ISpectrum.Centroids
member.summary: Get access to the centroids and further information to those peaks. An empty enumeration is returned if centroid information is not present. This value will not be null.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.ISpectrum.ChargeEnvelopes
member.summary: Access to the array of all charge envelopes found in the spectrum. An empty array will be returned if nothing had been found. null will be returned if the detector's processing software doesn't support detection of charge envelopes for this scan.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.INoiseNode
member.summary: One noise node is part of a set of noise nodes which describe the individual noise by interpolation at a specific point. Each noise node should be combined with its neightbors in a polygonial way.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.INoiseNode.Baseline
member.summary: Baseline of the noise node. The value will be null if no baseline is available.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace covers the definition of a customer-accessible spectrum. A customer can be an API or a consuming program.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.Properties.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.SpectrumFormat_V1.Properties.Resources.link
member.summary: Looks up a localized resource of type System.Drawing.Icon similar to (Icon).
